clinical_study.brief_title: Reversibility of Diastolic Disfunction in Septic Shock
clinical_study.official_title: Early Reversibility of Diastolic Disfunction as a Prognostic Factor in Septic Shock

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

clinical_study.source: Fundació Institut de Recerca de l'Hospital de la Santa Creu i Sant Pau

brief_summary.textblock:
Objectives: To study the prognostic value of the evolution of diastolic function according to fluid balance in patients admitted to the ICU with a diagnosis of septic shock, in terms of mortality (ICU and hospital) and mortality at 90 days.
2.4. Secondary objectives: A) Incidence and reversibility of myocardial dysfunction (left ventricular systolic and diastolic) in septic shock.
B) Incidence and reversibility of diastolic dysfunction according to the echocardiographic criterion used.
C) Incidence and reversibility of right ventricular systolic dysfunction.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 24 hours of ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: According to the criteria specified at groups section

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in incidence of diastolic dysfunction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first 24 hours of ICU admission until 48h, 72h and 7 days from admission
secondary_outcome.description: Change in incidence of diastolic dysfunction according to the different criteria used.

arm_group.description: No systolic dysfunction No diastolic dysfunction No right ventricular dysfunction
Classification according to: Mitral lateral annulus e' in tissue Doppler < 10 cm/s American society of echocardiography (ASE) criteria 2009 ASE criteria 2016
Tricuspid annulus plane systolic excursion < 17 cm

intervention.description: Usual echocardiographic studies in patients suffering septic shock

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to the ICU with diagnosis of septic shock, and stay longer than 48h

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to the ICU with diagnosis of septic shock, and stay longer than 48h
Exclusion Criteria:
- No echocardiographic window
- Fatal prognosis with do not resuscitate orders at admission
- Previous history of Ischemic cardiomyopathy
- Valvular prosthesis
- Advanced degree of valvular disorder
- Advanced degree of pericardial effusion
